summary: Obtaining insurance from offshore companies can provide legitimate federal tax benefits, as long as the insurance is genuine and taxpayers accurately report assets, claim appropriate benefits, and pay taxes owed. But offshore insurance products can also be abused. We reviewed abuses of two types—"micro-captive insurance" and variable life insurance. For example, micro-captive insurance is when small insurance companies are owned by the businesses they insure...
title: Abusive Tax Schemes: Offshore Insurance Products and Associated Compliance Risks
